name: Yoso

contributors.name: Yoso
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Booking Agent - US
contributors.details: Yoso is an Austin-based hip-hop artist known for blending high-energy performance with melodic, emotionally driven records. His sound reflects Southern influence, ambition, and authentic storytelling, allowing him to connect with both hype-focused and vibe-driven audiences. After gaining traction with his breakout single “You Don’t Know,” which surpassed 200K+ views, Yoso has continued building momentum through consistent releases and strong digital engagement. His latest release “NOW” represents a new chapter focused on growth and creative evolution. With official SXSW artist recognition and an expanding catalog of music and visuals, Yoso continues to establish himself as a rising independent artist focused on long-term development, performance excellence, and cultural impact.

name: xBValentine

contributors.name: xBValentine
contributors.details: xBValentine is a queer Latina artist from Georgetown, Texas, unapologetically carving her own lane in the music world. As a first-generation creative, she’s spent over a decade breaking barriers from racking up accolades at open mics to sharing stages with names like Joyner Lucas, WESTSIDE Boogie, Snow Tha Product, Lupe Fiasco, & more. Known for her bold, genre-blending sound, XB’s music fuses hip-hop, R&B, and Latin influences, reflecting her diverse roots and fearless individuality. Her rise has been meteoric first going viral in 2020 with her LGBTQ+ anthem “Vibe With You,” surpassing a million streams across platforms. In 2023, she made waves again with Paul Wall on “LIKE DIS,” amassing over 10 million TikTok views. Most recently, her hit “Don’t Play With Me” featuring Amanda Perez exploded online, earning 2.2 billion TikTok views, nearing 1 million YouTube views, and surpassing a million streams across platforms. xB isn’t just a voice; she’s a movement.

name: Canon

contributors.name: Canon
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Booking Agent - US, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details: Canon is an independent artist who turns pain into purpose and lyrics into lifelines. Raised between Chicago and Atlanta, his music is raw, cinematic, and rooted in real-life battles—surviving trauma, questioning faith, rebuilding identity, and refusing to quit. Every bar is personal, every beat intentional. He doesn’t make music to impress—he makes it to connect, to challenge, to heal. Fully hands-on with his sound, visuals, and message, Canon creates from a place of truth, and invites his listeners to face theirs. This isn’t just music—it’s movement. Welcome to the journey.

name: Same Same But Different

contributors.name: Lauren Noll
contributors.details:
Lauren Noll is an L.A. based actor-director from the mountains of East Tennessee. Her feature
directorial debut, SAME SAME BUT DIFFERENT, is a female-driven ensemble comedy
highlighting three women navigating the tensions of their cross-cultural relationships and the
pressures of modern life, friendship, and womanhood. It will premiere at SXSW 2026.

Hailing from a rich background in theatre, she earned her graduate degree in Acting at Harvard’s
American Repertory Theater (A.R.T.) and the Moscow Art Theatre (MXAT) before her focus
pivoted toward film. Lauren first stepped behind the camera with the short drama HONOR, an
intimate, autobiographically inspired story about coming of age, coming out, and facing
expulsion from Brigham Young University. The film earned multiple awards and launched her
new path as a filmmaker. She followed this short debut with GEN V, which began an ongoing
creative partnership with actor-writer Dalia Rooni and secured the pair a development deal with
Adi Shankar’s Bootleg Universe. The duo went on to make CLEAN SLATE, a recipient of the
Collaborative Film Challenge Grand Jury Prize and a grant from Blackmagic Design, before
embarking to make their first feature film SAME SAME BUT DIFFERENT together.

Most recently, Lauren co-wrote and starred in the Oscar Qualified short film, THE HEART OF
TEXAS, which screened at more than 75 festivals worldwide and earned Lauren a dozen acting
awards on the festival circuit for her performance as Janie May, a down-on-her-luck country
singer caught between a last shot at her dream and the crushing responsibility she bears for
another dreamer she collides with on her path. Across all of her work, Lauren is drawn to
intimate, character-driven stories about ordinary people searching for grace and meaning in
chaotic worlds. Her love for actors and their craft is undeniably infused into her directing style.
She approaches each project with honesty, humor, and deep compassion, crafting stories that
reveal the beauty and hilarity of being human.

events.name: The Oldest Person in the World

image.alt_text: The Oldest Person in the World

thumbnail.alt_text: The Oldest Person in the World

long_description: When Rana’s visa application is denied, she faces the reality of returning home to Iran. That is, until Adam – her wealthy boss’s son and her summer fling – proposes a green card wedding. Wrestling with the implications of his offer, Rana enlists help from a questionable shaman, Adam’s pure-hearted mom, and most importantly her two Iranian best friends Nadia and Setareh, who arrive on Cape Cod for a wedding weekend full of opinions, chaos, and drama with their own American boyfriends. Just as total disaster approaches, the three women come together in a transformative moment of acceptance, growth, and coming of age – evolving this weekend into one that will change them all forever.

name: Wishful Thinking

contributors.name: Graham Parkes
contributors.details: Graham Parkes is a writer and director from Los Angeles, working in both film and independent games. He currently works at GoodbyeWorld Games, an indie video game studio he co-founded with childhood friends. They released their first title in 2021, Before Your Eyes, a cinematic narrative game Graham both wrote and directed.

events.name: See You When I See You

image.alt_text: See You When I See You

thumbnail.alt_text: See You When I See You

long_description: Julia and Charlie, a volatile couple in Portland, Oregon, are at a loss for how to repair their broken relationship. Julia, an ambitious game designer, and Charlie, a struggling musician working in sound design to pay the bills, are pushed by Julia's friend into attending a couples-therapy seminar run by twin healers, the Tillies, who claim to fix relationships through energy work. The session triggers a karmic universal system that makes the state of their relationship affect the world around them. With earthquakes, the stock market, and entire nations at risk, Charlie and Julia must confront whether their love can survive amidst so much destruction.

films.logline: When a volatile couple discovers their emotional state has supernatural consequences on the world around them, they must decide whether to fight for their relationship or accept that their powerful connection might be doing more harm than good.
films.long_description: Julia and Charlie, a volatile couple in Portland, Oregon, are at a loss for how to repair their broken relationship. Julia, an ambitious game designer, and Charlie, a struggling musician working in sound design to pay the bills, are pushed by Julia's friend into attending a couples-therapy seminar run by twin healers, the Tillies, who claim to fix relationships through energy work. The session triggers a karmic universal system that makes the state of their relationship affect the world around them. With earthquakes, the stock market, and entire nations at risk, Charlie and Julia must confront whether their love can survive amidst so much destruction.

contributors.name: Evan Mascagni
contributors.details: Evan Mascagni is an award-winning director and producer based in Kentucky. His latest documentary feature, "Building a Bridge," premiered at the Tribeca Festival and was executive produced by Martin Scorsese. Named to DOC NYC’s 40 Under 40 emerging filmmakers, Evan’s recent work has been featured on Sundance TV, AMC+, and PBS. He runs Slaughterhouse 502, a production company proudly based in Louisville, Kentucky.

contributors.name: Drew Morris
contributors.details: Drew Morris is a director focused on subjects who have a peculiar relationship with societal norms. His debut doc feature, "Exile By Choice (2015)," streamed on Hulu. Since then, he has directed documentary projects for Atlantic Records, "Croptober" (2020, a 6 part series), and Joe Budden’s Humans series (2023). Morris runs Born Ready Films, an LA based content house that produces projects for a range of brands and organizations.

long_description:
The unbelievable true story of the Cornbread Mafia, a group of Kentucky farmers who built the largest domestic marijuana syndicate in U.S. history. Sons of tobacco farmers, moonshiners, and bootleggers, they turned to pot to keep their families fed.  

What followed was straight out of Kentucky folklore: lion cubs on the farm, backroad police chases, and a code of silence that baffled prosecutors. Part true crime and part cartoon, the film blends community, the War on Drugs, and a whole lot of weed with the humor and heart of the folks who lived it.

long_description: Alex and her boyfriend Joey head into the wilderness for a romantic getaway. When Alex turns down Joey's surprise proposal, he abandons her in the woods. She’s rescued by Kianna and Matt, an enigmatic young couple living off the grid. Stranded and shaken, Alex accepts their invitation to stay at their remote campsite. As she’s drawn into their intoxicating world, complicated emotions and unexpected connections begin to surface. But when she learns they’re fugitives wanted for a string of violent bank robberies, Alex must navigate the blurred lines between desire, loyalty, and survival.

name: The Reverent Few

contributors.name: The Reverent Few
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Brand Partnership, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, PR/Publicity Agency, Publishing
contributors.details: The Reverent Few emerged from Chicago’s blues scene and have called Austin home for over a decade. They are a band bound  by shared history, raw honesty, and a lived-in belief in the power of music to connect and heal. With voices that carry like old hymns and instrumentation that cuts with both grit and grace, their songs aren’t just played, they’re inhabited. There’s gospel in the bones, blues in the breath, and rock and roll in the resolve. Their debut album, Ain’t No Place to Be (2020), was recorded in Dripping Springs and released through Bearpath Records. It's an eight-track collection steeped in soul both sonically and spiritually featuring contributions from Anthony Farrell of The Greyhounds. Critics praised its emotional weight and its blend of warmth, pain, and resilience. Their latest single, The World Will Be Wood to You, recorded live to tape at DogStar Studios, is a raw, analog meditation on loss and grace. Written during quiet reckonings and bedside goodbyes, it holds ache and light in equal measure. It's an offering, a gesture toward gentleness in a fractured world. The Reverent Few remind us that tenderness still matters, that community still holds.

name: Electric Enemy

contributors.name: Electric Enemy
contributors.artist_connection: Gear Endorsement, Distribution - US, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
Electric Enemy is the alternative rock project of London-based multi-instrumentalist and three-time award-winning songwriter Jim Lawton. Fusing the raw power of Muse, Royal Blood and Foo Fighters with sharp social commentary and introspective lyricism, Electric Enemy deliver a high-energy sound built for modern rock stages.

With 15M+ streams, multiple sold-out tours, #1 and #3 European iTunes Rock chart positions, eight weeks in Germany’s Top Rock Radio chart, and a #1 spot on TikTok’s GSA Rock playlist, the band has quickly established itself as a standout international live act.

Renowned for their explosive performances, Electric Enemy were personally invited to support Jerry Cantrell on tour across Europe, with Lawton requested to duet on Cantrell’s iconic Rooster at the London Shepherd’s Bush Empire finale. Recent headline and showcase performances across Italy and Germany have further accelerated their global momentum.

Outside the band, Lawton is an in-demand multi genre writer-producer for Universal-Sony + his music secured multiple sync placements with Netflix, ESPN, Disney+ WarnerBros+Gibson Guitars. “Is this the best live band in the UK”? - Sat Bisla - A & R Worldwide

name: Stages

contributors.name: Ryan Booth
contributors.details: Ryan Booth is a director drawn to raw and authentic storytelling. His background in music and cinematography deeply informs his work, shaping a style rooted in rhythm, texture, and emotional detail. Drawing from real-life experience and personal connection, Booth crafts narratives that often live between documentary and fiction, offering an intimate window into the quiet nuances of human relationships and the world around them. Over the years, he has collaborated with a wide range of clients—from indie musicians to global brands to some of the world’s biggest talent—bringing the same care and curiosity to every project, no matter the scale. Off set, Booth remains closely engaged with the filmmaking community, openly sharing process, experience, and hard-earned lessons with aspiring directors and emerging talent as they build their own paths forward.

long_description: It's make or break time for Ben Garza as he embarks on his solo first tour after the collapse of his band. By his side are Rita, his former tour manager stepping away from her stable life to help him, and Parker, a remaining bandmate who joins Ben as a utility player. However, Rita also secures Jessie Ramos as the opening act, a rising star whose sudden surge in popularity will completely destabilize Ben. Throughout this musical odyssey, Ben will face characters on the road who challenge his ideas of success, relevance, and purpose. Some encounters offer hope; others deepen his doubt. By the tour’s end, Ben must decide whether to keep chasing the life he once had—or chart a new path forward.

name: Cure for Paranoia

contributors.name: Cure for Paranoia
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
Formed in the heart of Dallas but born on the highway, Cure for Paranoia came together during a “doomsday road trip” intended to be their last. Having recently been diagnosed with bipolar paranoid schizophrenia, frontman Cameron McCloud found clarity in a hot-boxed rental car; making music with collaborators Jay Analog and Tomahawk Jonez gave him peace of mind. “He said, ‘this is my cure for paranoia.’ Instantly, everyone’s eyes lit up,” a pivotal realization that cemented the group’s moniker. When the predicted earth-shattering meteor failed to hit, inspiration struck instead. As Jonez recalls, “On the way from Amarillo to Colorado Springs, like eight songs got written.”

Since then, Cure for Paranoia has shared bills with icons ranging from George Clinton & Parliament Funkadelic and Nas to Ludacris and Leon Bridges. Their resume includes stops at SXSW, Fortress Festival, and the NPR Tiny Desk Contest "On The Road" Tour, solidifying their status as festival favorites. While keen to distance themselves from standard regional production, they cultivated a signature "Trippy Soul infused hip hop" sound—a blend prioritized on their anchor project, the Work of A.R.T. EP.

long_description: Jimmy wakes up in a bathtub filled with his own blood, his wrists slit and his life rapidly nearly completion. This would be a textbook failed suicide attempt, only…Jimmy didn’t do it? At least, he’s pretty sure he didn’t. Alongside Margot, the 911 operator who took his call that faithful night, Jimmy begins an amateur-hour murder investigation, desperate to prove that this is a whodunnit and not a hedunnit. The list of suspects who might be happy if Jimmy wasn’t around anymore is fairly long—angry ex-girlfriends, frustrated siblings, exasperated psychiatrists, and resentful stepfathers. But the prime suspect is Jimmy himself.

long_description: In 1980, an ingenious boobie-trapped ticking time bomb - filled with 1,000 pounds of dynamite - was wheeled in the front doors of Harvey’s Wagon Wheel Casino in Lake Tahoe. Along with the bomb was a note demanding $3 million within 24 hours. While the bomb squad attempts to disarm the explosive, the FBI races the clock to deliver the ransom and simultaneously catch the extortionists. Nothing goes as planned, and each step uncovers darker secrets and suspicions of a deeper motive.

thumbnail.alt_text: First They Came for My College

long_description: In 1980, an ingenious boobie-trapped ticking time bomb - filled with 1,000 pounds of dynamite - was wheeled in the front doors of Harvey’s Wagon Wheel Casino in Lake Tahoe. Along with the bomb was a note demanding $3 million within 24 hours. While the bomb squad attempts to disarm the explosive, the FBI races the clock to deliver the ransom and simultaneously catch the extortionists. Nothing goes as planned, and each step uncovers darker secrets and suspicions of a deeper motive.

name: congratulations

contributors.name: congratulations
contributors.details:
congratulations are a hall of mirrors party troop. they are devils and tarts in equal measure. they lock their horns and then spin round and round and round until dizzy cacophony erupts. sugarcane hooks vs. slaughterhouse screams. taut, fizzing guitars & caustic electronics nipping at the heels of huge fuzz bass & booming percussive grooves. leah is the green one. jamie is dressed in blue. greg’s red, james is yellow. they’re here to move you.

Bursting onto the scene with a kinetic new sound, congratulations have quickly garnered a reputation for their raw energy, tight instrumentation and electrifying live performances. With punchy melodies and infectious hooks, congratulations deliver a mix of anthemic and experimental sounds fusing art-rock, garage, synth-pop and post-punk. The band’s lyrics explore themes of modern life, love, and self-discovery, delivered with a compelling honesty and emotion. congratulations’ fresh take on familiar sounds has earned them critical acclaim and a devoted and rapidly-growing fanbase, positioning them as one of the UK’s most exciting up-and-coming acts.

Signed to Bella Union records, with the bands debut album "Join Hands" due for release on February 13th. 

Having gained support previously from BBC Radio 1 and BBC 6Music including a live session for 6Music for Marc Riley.  Previous supporters of congratulations include Iggy Pop, Craig Charles, Nick Grimshaw, Chris Hawkins and Jess Izzatt.

long_description: Maggie works as a content moderator for VueQ Moderation Services, spending her days filtering the internet’s darkest content, driven by guilt over her sister's suicide.  When Maggie blocks a cryptic video uploaded by an anonymous user, she and her team begin to be hunted by an insidious entity that haunts them through every screen in their lives.

name: Ali Almighty

contributors.name: Ali Almighty
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Distribution - US, Distribution - Worldwide, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, PR/Publicity Agency, Producer/Studio Engineer, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
Ali Almighty, born Aaliyah Ashante White, is a rising rapper from Greenville, TX, proudly known as the "Queen of da 903." Her music blends Southern rap with contemporary sounds, creating a unique and captivating style that resonates with a diverse audience.  
Her latest album, *EA$T TX $HAWTY*, showcases her lyrical talent and storytelling, offering authentic narratives rooted in her experiences. With compelling beats and insightful lyrics, she is quickly gaining recognition in the rap community.  
Beyond music, Ali Almighty actively engages with her growing fanbase on social media, sharing her journey and connecting with supporters. Her strong online presence has helped build a dedicated following eager for her next move.  
Inspired daily by her family, Ali Almighty is a testament to resilience—never willing to give up or give in. Focused on making a lasting impact, she continues pushing boundaries, representing her East Texas roots with powerful and authentic music.

name: Grind

contributors.name: Brea Grant
contributors.details: Brea Grant has directed three films -- "Best Friends Forever" (2013, cowriter/costar), "12 Hour Shift" (2020, writer), and the Blumhouse film, "Torn Hearts". She also wrote/starred in the film "Lucky" (2020) , directed by Natasha Kermani. She is also a former actress ("Friday Night Lights", "Dexter"), a book podcaster, and a Texan.

contributors.name: Ed Dougherty, Chelsea Stardust
contributors.details:
Ed Dougherty -- Ed Dougherty cowrote/coproduced the film PAINT IT BLACK with Amber Tamblyn and cowrote the award-winning drama SCRAPPER. He also produced the “D is for Dogfight” segment of THE ABCS OF DEATH. He most recently sold the limited series THE AMITYVILLE HOAX to Peacock. He's a graduate of UC Berkeley and the USC Graduate School of Cinema-Television and was in the 2019 Sundance Film Two Lab. He's also directed music videos for Voxtrot, A Giant Dog, Sweet Spirit, Tracyanne and Danny, and many others.

Chelsea Stardust -- Upon graduating Ohio University's Honors Tutorial College School of Film program Chelsea moved to Los Angeles to pursue her filmmaking dreams. 
Chelsea’s first feature film, the science fiction thriller All That We Destroy, is part of the Blumhouse series Into The Dark and stars Samantha Mathis, Frank Whaley, and Aurora Perrineau. It was written by Sean Keller and James Agnew (Dario Argento’s Giallo, Nicolas Cage’s Rage) and is currently available on Hulu. 
Her second feature film, the horror comedy Satanic Panic, was written by novelist Grady Hendrix (My Best Friend’s Exorcism, How To Sell A Haunted House) and stars Hayley Griffith, Ruby Modine, Rebecca Romijn, and Jerry O’Connell. It was featured in over 20 film festivals all over the world and is currently available on VOD, blu-ray and VHS.

thumbnail.credit: Courtesy of Beautiful Stories and AJNA Films

long_description:
This horror anthology tackles the modern work landscape through four timely perspectives – the hustle culture of an MLM, the endless repetitiveness of a food delivery driver, the online horrors of a content moderator, and the unionization of a familiar-feeling coffee shop. "Grind" shows what it means to be a worker in a world defined by wealth inequality and ruled by endlessly greedy oligarchs, one not so far removed from our own. 

This is a film for anyone who's ever hated their job, had a bad boss, or felt taken advantage of at work. In other words, it's a film for all of us.

name: Sinner Supper Club

contributors.name: Daisy Rosato
contributors.details: Daisy Rosato (she/her) is a queer, neurodivergent filmmaker who hails from New Orleans. Her “darkly funny and deeply unsettling” (RueMorgue) short film POSSUM (2024, director/co-writer) played at 12+ festivals, including Slamdance, Final Girls Berlin (Audience Award), and streamed on Shudder in partnership with Access:Horror (Best Short). Screenwriting honors: Austin Film Festival, Stowe Story Labs, Studiofest VR. Bafta Scholar at Feirstein Graduate School of Cinema, 2026 MFA in Screenwriting. daisyrosato.com

contributors.name: Nora Kaye
contributors.details: Nora Kaye (she/her) is a queer MA-born, NYC-based filmmaker. Her work has played at Cannes, Seriesfest, and Bentonville, and includes "The Cosmos Sisters" (Gravitas Ventures, Amazon, feature film) and "Hysterical Women" (pilot). She has worked as a development intern with FilmNation (Anora, Promising Young Woman) and is pursuing an MFA in Screenwriting from Feirstein Graduate School of Cinema (FGSC). Her comedy feature-length script," The Head Cases," about warring women in neuroscience just won the Sloan Discovery Student Prize. norakaye.com

events.name: Dead Deer High

long_description:
Nora is late. Alice unceremoniously brought her partner, whose name no one can remember. Jayae doesn't want to be around "these" people...but came anyway? And Genevieve, the host, has put an unhealthy amount of pressure on this eviction funeral (kinda cringe, right?) to solve all of their problems. 

As they barrel through the evening, this disintegrating friend group, delirious from the heat and lack of food, desperately throws Hail Marys, caution to the wind, and lamb against the wall, trying to harness some semblance of what they used to have.

...and then their dead friend shows up.

name: Lucky

contributors.name: Lucky
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, PR/Publicity Agency, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
Growing up in Staghorn Flat, Victoria, Lucky burst onto the scene in flurry of fuzzy guitars
and captivating storytelling. Blending the raw energy of alternative rock, with the dreamy
haze of modern indie, her music captures the nuances of life's everyday moments and
dives deep, putting you right at the centre of her world.

Having supported the likes of The Belair Lip Bombs, Hockey Dad, Armlock and Dear
Seattle, the Melbourne based artist is set for an exciting 2026 - following the release of
her single ‘Lady Beetle’, Lucky is building a devoted audience who are eagerly waiting to
see what’s in store next.

name: Mama Duke

contributors.name: Mama Duke
contributors.details: Fresh off the national spotlight of America’s Got Talent, Mama Duke has emerged as one of the most commanding voices in music and culture today. As a Season 20 finalist, she earned Mel B’s coveted Golden Buzzer, launching her straight into the finals and into living rooms across the country. In that historic run, she became the first female rapper ever to reach the Top 10 in the show’s history—shattering expectations and proving that rap can be stadium-sized, deeply vulnerable, and undeniably powerful all at once. Comparisons to icons like Missy Elliott followed, but Mama Duke made it clear. She’s not here to imitate, she’s here to redefine.

name: Glassio

contributors.name: Glassio
contributors.artist_connection: Gear Endorsement, Booking Agent - Worldwide, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details: Glassio is the Dream-Pop–tinged Indie-Dance project of Irish-Iranian songwriter and producer Sam R. Blending melodic sweetness with brooding dance beats, his self-described “melancholy disco” sound has earned over 25 million streams and global acclaim. Since emerging with the viral 2016 EP Poptimism (whose single “Try Much Harder” hit No. 9 on Spotify’s Global Viral Chart), Glassio has toured internationally with acts like Clap Your Hands Say Yeah, Nada Surf, and Electric Youth, and released two acclaimed LPs—For the Very Last Time (2020, Downtown Music) and See You Shine (2022)—with songs featured on Netflix and HBO. Raised between the Middle East and California and later based in New York and London, Sam draws influence from New Wave, 60s chamber pop, and early-2000s electronica, channeling it into rich, cinematic pop. His upcoming third album, The Imposter (2026), written during his move from New York to London, fuses shoegaze, folk, and dream pop in a neo-noir exploration of self-confrontation and creative rebirth. “I wanted this album to make people ask if they’re living the life they’re meant to,” he says. “For me, this is about rediscovering who I am as an artist.

name: indie tribe

contributors.name: indie tribe
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Other Artists to Tour With
contributors.details: Indie Tribe is an influential independent Christian hip-hop collective founded in 2016 by rapper nobigdyl.. Currently, the group consists of nobigdyl., Mogli the Iceburg, Jon Keith, DJ Mykael V, and Torey D'Shaun. Known for their high-energy, collaborative, and authentic style, they blend diverse musical influences with faith-based lyrics to bring glory to God. In 2026, they are set to release their first album since 2023, along with a full tour & their 6th annual festival, Holy Smoke.

and killer guitars.

name: NIGHT DRIVE

contributors.name: NIGHT DRIVE
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide
contributors.details:
“Exactly the kind of glossy, echoed Interpol and Lower Dens vibes that are ideal to put on while rocketing down the interstate at 90mph in the dead of night.” — Spin Magazine

Night Drive transforms cinematic sci-fi landscapes into high-impact synth-pop. Their emotive style fuses shadowed textures and reflective lyrics with soaring hooks and driving beats, creating a sleek, kinetic sound that has resonated across film, television, and radio worldwide.
Touring alongside Crystal Castles, CHVRCHES, Ladytron, ACTORS and The Psychedelic Furs, the group has built a reputation for immersive live performances that resonate long after the final note. New releases arriving very soon.

long_description:
“Exactly the kind of glossy, echoed Interpol and Lower Dens vibes that are ideal to put on while rocketing down the interstate at 90mph in the dead of night.” — Spin Magazine

Night Drive transforms cinematic sci-fi landscapes into high-impact synth-pop. Their emotive style fuses shadowed textures and reflective lyrics with soaring hooks and driving beats, creating a sleek, kinetic sound that has resonated across film, television, and radio worldwide.
Touring alongside Crystal Castles, CHVRCHES, Ladytron, ACTORS and The Psychedelic Furs, the group has built a reputation for immersive live performances that resonate long after the final note. New releases arriving very soon.

name: Olivia Ellen Lloyd

contributors.name: Olivia Ellen Lloyd
contributors.artist_connection: Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe
contributors.details:
Olivia Ellen Lloyd will try anything once. From flight attendant school in Dallas to producing theater in New York City and teaching in Guatemala, Lloyd sought an adventurous life, but struggled to find a greater sense of purpose. That is, until she found her way back to music. Lloyd channels her restless spirit into songs that pay homage to her Appalachian roots while charting fresh territory for a sound that is uniquely her own. 

Heavily influenced by country, folk, and indie rock, Lloyd’s sound combines the rooted sounds of her traditional Appalachian upbringing with the fly-by-the-seat-of-your-pants nature of her current life. She is inspired by the rich sounds of New York City, the peaceful quiet of her small West Virginia hometown, and life on the road in between.

Her 2025 sophomore record "Do It Myself" landed her debut appearances at Mountain Stage, Americana Fest, and Brooklyn Folk Festival and her debut album, Loose Cannon, has been streamed over 1 million times while Olivia has been busy crossing the country opening for artists like Kelsey Waldon, Tommy Prine, and Jobi Riccio, winning songwriting contests (Kerrville in 2023), and generally eating life down to the rind.

name: Angela Autumn

contributors.name: Angela Autumn
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details: Angela Autumn is a songwriter and banjo player from a forgotten steel town. Strongly tied to the buried stories of her childhood, her dark country songs reinvent folk tradition through the lens of eco-feminist transcendentalism. The singer’s straightforward lack of pretension speaks from the vantage point of the outsider— and, often — the sounds of the unspoken.

name: Julie Nolen

contributors.name: Julie Nolen
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Distribution - Worldwide, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, PR/Publicity Agency, Producer/Studio Engineer, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
Julie Nolen is a Texas-based singer-songwriter whose music blends raw storytelling with the grit of rock & roll. Born under the wide-open skies of West Texas, her songs carry the dust of desert highways and the resilience of those who call them home. A proud voice in queer country, Julie brings authenticity to a genre rooted in tradition, proving that country music is for everyone.

In 2025, she was an official SXSW artist, showcasing her dynamic live performance. Now, she’s rolling out a five-song project leading up to a full EP drop in time for AmericanaFest in September. The lead single, “Love Me When I’m Leaving,” sets the tone for a collection of songs that explore the beauty and heartbreak of moving on.

Whether playing an intimate acoustic set or leading a full band, Julie delivers music that’s as honest as it is powerful. 

Little bit moody, little bit soulful country, a little in your face, unapologetic, bold.

name: Sultanes del Yonke

contributors.name: Sultanes del Yonke
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Distribution - Worldwide, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, PR/Publicity Agency
contributors.details: Born on the frontera, Sultanes del Yonke channels the chaos, color, and rhythm of the border into a sound built from the unexpected. As they prepare to promote their debut album, due in April, the band is evolving its sound — keeping their regional rhythms and DIY spirit while weaving in samples, drum machines, and experimental, dance-driven styles. This collision of influences does true justice to the yonke in their name: raw, eclectic, and born from the beautiful chaos of the border. Recent milestones include a tour supporting Tropa Mágica and a standout performance at SXSW, solidifying their expanding live footprint.

name: Holy Gabbana

contributors.name: Holy Gabbana
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Distribution - US, Distribution - Worldwide, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, PR/Publicity Agency, Producer/Studio Engineer, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
John Robert Hill Jr. (b. August 3, 1996), better known by his stage name Holy Gabbana, is a rapper coming out of Jacksonville, Florida.

In December of 2018, John was sentenced to 5 months in county jail and had a life changing experience. He began to grow an understanding of Jesus Christ due to his cellmate, which ultimately led him to getting saved and starting a Christian hip hop career. He released his first single as a Christian rapper, “Holy Flow” in August 2022.

name: Reilly Downes

contributors.name: Reilly Downes
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Other Artists to Tour With
contributors.details:
Reilly Downes is a torchbearer of modern heartbreak, blending rustbelt grit with cosmic country soul. Hailing from Texas and now rooted in the Chicago music scene, she’s made a name for herself with her “small, but mighty” voice and songs that cut to the bone. Downes has shared the stage with artists like Maggie Rose, Kaitlin Butts, and Jaime Wyatt, and has been featured in Rollingstone.

With a background in both the Americana and indie circuits, Reilly delivers raw, emotionally charged performances with her band, The Acid Cowboys. Her songs, like sad polaroids of  love and loss, explore themes of queer identity, grief, and survival.

She is currently in the process of recording her sophomore album with executive production by Jaime Wyatt who has worked alongside Butch Walker, Shooter Jennings, The Black Pumas, and more.

name: Firecracker

contributors.name: Firecracker
contributors.details:
Firecracker is a punk rock’n’roll outfit from Bologna, Italy,
born in 2020. Their sound fuses the raw edge of punk
with grunge‑driven moods and a straight‑ahead,
no‑nonsense attitude. After a lineup shake‑up in 2023,
the band tightened its direction, keeping its trademark
grit while pushing for richer, more dynamic
arrangements. April 2025 saw the release of their new
EP Not Your City, a record that captures Firecracker’s
evolution and marks a new chapter in their sonic
journey.

name: Honey Made

contributors.name: Honey Made
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Brand Partnership, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details: Austin’s Honey Made delivers a modern, high-energy spin on vintage soul -and funk, channeling legends like James Brown, Sly and the Family Stone, and Earth, Wind & Fire while staying rooted in rich R&B traditions. Honey Made calls its take on contemporary RnB, Texas RnB.  It is RnB with Texas Heat. Named Best Live Band in Austin by Austin Fit Magazine twice in a row, the band’s dynamic performances have earned them multiple official SXSW showcases, and stages alongside Karl Denson’s Tiny Universe, The Soul Rebels, Funk You, and The Spin Doctors. With acclaimed releases including Brand New, Charge It To The Band Fund, and Pass Me By, Honey Made is quickly expanding their reach beyond Austin with their infectious hooks, fearless funk grooves, and a sound that invites every listener into the fold.

name: DJ Trendsetter Sense + Trendsetter Cypher

contributors.name: DJ Trendsetter Sense + Trendsetter Cypher
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Producer/Studio Engineer, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
DJ Sense, a founding member of "The Aphilliates,
" gained recognition as Trendsetter
Sense. Co Creator of the famous brand “Gangsta Grillz & Gangsta Grillz Radio,
landing shows on Eminem's Shade 45 and Atlanta's Hot 107.9, reaching over 30
million listeners. He then produced the mixtape series"Rhythm &
Streets”,collaborating with artists like Monica, Chris Brown, T Pain, Akon, Usher,
K.Michelle & more. In 2016, he partnered with Lil Jon, managing his worldwide tour.
Trendsetter expands his influence with Chosen Journey, a new chapter in his brand
that merges Faith, Music and Culture. Through this platform, he uplifts artist
perspectives in modern media while embracing a transformative path rooted in
faith based and purpose driven living.
Chosen Journey made history with the first ever Christian Hip Hop set at Rolling
Loud Miami 2024. Returning with CHOSEN JOURNEY PART II ROLLING LOUD ORLANDO 2026.
The Rise of Christian Hip Hop has opened a powerful new door
that a new generation desires to be filled with a message of fullfillment and
inspiration. Catch Trendsetter Sense’s Chosen Journey shows every Sunday from 8-
10am ET on HOT 107.9 ATL and SiriusXM Hip Hop Nation 10-12p ET.

name: Samy Sharif

contributors.name: Samy Sharif
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Gear Endorsement, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
Samy Sharif moved to Los Angeles in mid 2023 to launch a solo effort after having spent the prior decade in the Chicago-based Alternative quartet, Bonelang. 

In 2024, he released three albums (House of Failure, House of Fix, and House of Bliss) that were then put together and re-released as one large body of work entitled Three Houses. 
​
​Samy is a first generation Egyptian/Irish artist; New York born and Chicago raised. He is a published poet, songwriter, and an aspiring writer/director.

name: Calder Allen

contributors.name: Calder Allen
contributors.artist_connection: Distribution - US, Distribution - Worldwide, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
Born and raised in Austin, Texas, Calder Allen is a fifth-generation Texan whose music reflects the deep roots and creative spirit of his upbringing. Influenced by his artist grandparents, Terry and Jo Harvey Allen, Calder grew up surrounded by authentic artistic expression. Originally set on becoming a fly-fishing guide, he turned to songwriting during the 2020 pandemic, leading to his debut album The Game, produced by mentor Charlie Sexton.
With his new album, Fault Lines, recorded at Austin’s legendary Arlyn Studios with Sexton and Jacob Sciba, Calder delivers his most personal work yet—a cinematic exploration of love, loss, and self-discovery. Featuring contributions from Martie Maguire, Jon Randall, and Jack Ingram, the record captures the emotional depth and honesty at the heart of his songwriting.
A commanding live performer, Calder has shared stages with Cody Jinks, Turnpike Troubadours, Miranda Lambert, and others, earning acclaim at festivals like Austin City Limits, Bonnaroo, and Two Step Inn. With Fault Lines, Calder Allen cements himself as a powerful new voice in Americana, blending Texas tradition with raw, introspective storytelling.

name: Secret Family

contributors.name: Secret Family
contributors.details: Bump the mids and tap the fuzz.  Insert sway, conjure a bounce: jangle, thud, chime. A union hall for proletariat pipe dreams. Soundtracks for the world’s longest lunch break. Friends on amaro. Wind chapped melodies pulled thru the fog conduit. Sounds hung in vaped memory, old friends/new feelings. Music for garbage trucks and the babble of brooks. Anchored in Bay Area garage lust and Montana river rock. Rock for now. Rock however. Taste like always. Rock n’ roll for whomever.
